description: Unlike most prints by Utagawa Hiroshige, this work is based on folklore. Japanese tradition holds that on New Year’s Eve, foxes gather at a specific tree near the Oji Inari Shrine in preparation for a visit there. On the way to the shrine, the foxes produce distinctive flames from their mouths that the local farmers can use to predict the coming year's crops.
artist_info:
Utagawa Hiroshige 歌川 広重
Japanese
1797-1858
title: New Year’s Eve Fox Fires at the Changing Tree (Ōji shozoku enoki omisoka no kitsunebi), from the series One Hundred Famous Views of Edo (Meisho Edo hyakkei)
